an6.89:1.1: “Mendicants, without giving up six things you can’t become accomplished in view.
an6.89:1.3: Identity view, doubt, misapprehension of precepts and observances, and forms of greed, hate, and delusion that lead to rebirth in places of loss.
an6.89:1.4: Without giving up these six things you can’t become accomplished in view.
an6.89:2.1: After giving up six things you can become accomplished in view.
an6.89:2.3: Identity view, doubt, misapprehension of precepts and observances, and forms of greed, hate, and delusion that lead to rebirth in places of loss.
an6.89:2.4: After giving up these six things you can become accomplished in view.”
